evidence.pdf_reference: into the TiO 2 film.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and photoluminescence spectra suggested that the TiO 2 and ZIF-8 were coupled by chemical bonding.The ZIF-8 decorated TiO 2 film exhibited excellent CO 2 capture capacity and showed remarkably enhanced yield for reducing CO 2 to CO and CH 4 when compared with pure TiO 2 film.The probable mechanism of the photoreduction process is also discussed.

is considered that the large amount of ZIF-8 in TiMOF-3 essentially covered the TiO 2 , which can be confirmed in the SEM images, and thus inhibited the photo excitation process of TiO 2 .Compared with pure TiO 2 film, TiMOF-2 improved CO yield by 38 (0.53 mmol g -1 h -1 ) and CH 4 yield by 157 (0.18 mmol g -1 h -1 ).In general, CO yield can be enhanced easily by several strategies, while increasing CH 4 yield is much more difficult.In the photocatalysis process, CO 2 consumes two electrons to transform

H 2 O 2 solution (30wt), methanol and zinc nitrate hexahydrate were purchased from China Experiment Reagent Co., Ltd.(analytical grade).2-methylimidazole was purchased from Aladdin Reagent (Shanghai) Co., Ltd.(analytical grade).Commercial Ti-foil was purchased from Xinxin Metal Material Company, China.All reagents were used without further purification. the strong PL was quenched with ZIF-8 loading.It can be inferred that the incorporation of ZIF-8 can separate electron-hole pairs effectively, and suggests the existence of a path for charge carriers between TiO 2 and ZIF-8.The reduced recombination rate of charge carriers leads to more electrons involved in the photoreduction process. CO 2 molecules are stable and chemically inert with a closed-shell electronic configuration and linear geometry such that CO 2 reduction is a daunting challenge.In the

A strategy of coupling a photocatalyst with a high CO 2 adsorption capacity material was proposed in order to integrate CO 2 capture and photoreduction processes into a single system.TiO 2 and ZIF-8 were selected for their high photoactivity and CO 2 adsorption capacity respectively.We employed a facile in-situ growth strategy to inlay ZIF-8 into the TiO 2 film grid.X-ray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy revealed that ZIF-8 was successfully prepared and inlaid into the TiO 2 film.X-ray
